docs.lead_paragraph: Health news from around the Web.

headline.main: Drug Company Acquisition, the Nursing Shortage and Premium Assistance for the Unemployed

docs.snippet: Health news from around the Web.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Well column on Tuesday, about the role that doctors and patients play in health care reform, referred incorrectly to data from a study published in 2004. The researchers, analyzing mortality data from the 1990s, showed that only about 1 in 16,000 Americans per year had their lives extended or saved as a result of recent improvements in health care technology, not 1 in 16,000 over the entire study period.
